DataExpectations.Expectation: Must be a unique alphanumeric identifier for each user with 100% completeness - no null values allowed.
Must be a valid email format conforming to RFC 5322 standard, unique across all users, and requires PII anonymization for non-authorized access.
Must be one of the predefined values: Free, Basic, Pro, Business, Enterprise with 100% completeness.
Must be a unique alphanumeric identifier for each meeting with 100% completeness - no null values allowed.
Must be a non-negative integer between 0 and 1440 minutes (24 hours maximum) with 100% completeness.
Must be a valid timestamp in ISO format, and End_Time must be after Start_Time if both are provided.
Must be a valid timestamp in ISO format and must be after Start_Time when both timestamps are provided.
Must be one of the predefined values: Scheduled, Instant, Recurring, Webinar.
Must be a non-negative integer that cannot exceed the meeting duration and must align with join/leave time calculations.
Must be from the predefined feature catalog: Screen_Share, Chat, Recording, Breakout_Rooms, Whiteboard, Polls, Reactions, Virtual_Background.
Must be a positive integer greater than 0 representing the number of times a feature was used.
Must be from predefined categories: Audio_Issues, Video_Issues, Connectivity_Problems, Login_Issues, Billing_Questions, Feature_Request, Bug_Report, Account_Management, Technical_Support.
Must follow workflow values: Open, In_Progress, Pending_Customer, Resolved, Closed, Escalated with proper status transitions.
Must be a positive decimal number for revenue events, can be negative for refunds, with proper currency alignment.
Must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (3 characters) matching the user's billing region.
Must be from predefined values: Basic, Pro, Business, Enterprise, Developer, Educational and align with user's plan type.

Constraints.Description: Ensures each user has a unique identifier across the Users entity.
Ensures each meeting has a unique identifier across the Meetings entity.
Ensures each attendee record has a unique identifier across the Attendees entity.
Ensures each feature usage record has a unique identifier across the Features_Usage entity.
Ensures each support ticket has a unique identifier across the Support_Tickets entity.
Ensures each billing event has a unique identifier across the Billing_Events entity.
Ensures each license has a unique identifier across the Licenses entity.
Links meetings to users via Host_ID referencing Users.User_ID to ensure meeting hosts are valid users.
Links attendees and feature usage to meetings via Meeting_ID referencing Meetings.Meeting_ID.
Links attendees, feature usage, support tickets, billing events, and licenses to users via User_ID referencing Users.User_ID.
Ensures email addresses are unique across all active users in the system.
Ensures meeting duration is non-negative (>= 0) and does not exceed 1440 minutes (24 hours).
Ensures End_Time is after Start_Time when both timestamps are provided for meetings.
Ensures feature usage count is a positive integer (> 0).
Ensures billing amounts are positive for revenue events and properly validated based on event type.
Ensures license End_Date is after Start_Date for all license records.
Ensures Plan_Type values are restricted to: Free, Basic, Pro, Business, Enterprise.

BusinessRules.Description: The meeting host must be automatically included as an attendee in every meeting they host.
An attendee's duration in a meeting cannot exceed the total meeting duration.
Email addresses must be unique across all active users, but can be reused after user deletion and anonymization.
A user's plan type must align with their assigned license type to ensure proper feature access.
Support tickets must follow the proper status workflow: Open -> In_Progress -> Pending_Customer -> Resolved -> Closed, with Escalated as an alternative path.
Feature usage must align with the user's plan capabilities - users cannot use features not included in their plan type.
Meetings cannot exceed 24 hours (1440 minutes) in duration to maintain system performance and data quality.
The currency for billing events must match the user's billing region and account settings.
A user can have only one active license per license type at any given time.
Personal Identifiable Information (Email, User_Name, Attendee_Name) must be anonymized for non-authorized users and after user deletion retention periods.
All timestamp-related fields must maintain logical consistency - join times within meeting boundaries, close dates after open dates, etc.
All foreign key relationships must be maintained throughout the data lifecycle, with proper cascade or restrict policies for deletions.
Revenue-generating billing events must have positive amounts, while refunds can have negative amounts, with proper audit trails.
Transactional data must meet defined Service Level Agreement timeframes for data availability and processing.
All feature names used in Features_Usage must exist in the system's feature catalog and be properly maintained.
